questionsData.title: Vinegar is a liquid which can help in wasp stings.
Ice is one of the solid states.
The bowl of a spoon is convex, the back of it is concave.
Total and partial eclipse are the same.
To describe is to give the shape, size and colour of anything.
questionsData.explain_answer: Yes, that is a concise and accurate definition of describing something. To describe an object or thing is to provide details about its physical characteristics, such as its shape, size, and color.

questionsData.title: Beak and peak have the same meaning.
Spaceship is a kind of balloon.
When news spread very quickly, it means it spreads like a forest fire.
Duties are everything you have to do.
People with learning difficulties are those who learn easily.
"Madam" is a way of talking politely to a woman.
Brine is a kind of salted water.
Deck is the front part of the ship.
The text is mainly talking about ……….
questionsData.article: Snakes are different group of animals that can be found on every continent except Antarctica. (They 3) come in a wide variety of shapes and sizes, from the tiny thread snake to the huge Anaconda. Despite their reputation as dangerous creatures, snakes play an important role in the echo system as both predators and prey. One of the most striking features of snakes is their long, slim bodies. They have no limbs, and their scales and muscles allow them to move quickly and easily through a variety of natural surroundings from deserts to rainforests. Many snakes are also able to swim and climb, making them even more adaptable. Snakes are carnivores, they eat meat. They use their poisonous bites to kill their prey, and some kinds, like the Cobra, are capable of killing (humans 1). However, most snakes are not (dangerous 2) to humans and will only bite in self-defense. It is important to be aware of the dangers of snakes and to be careful when camping in snake’s areas.

questionsData.title: One of the following is NOT a compound word.
All Yemeni people would prefer to…… the war.
The ……..the money, the harder will be the life.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The less money, the harder will be the life.

  • Little suggests a small amount, but it doesn't necessarily imply difficulty.
  • Much and least don't fit the grammatical structure. We need a comparative adjective here to compare the amount of money with the difficulty of life.
  • Less is the appropriate comparative form of little. It indicates that as the amount of money gets smaller (less), life becomes harder.

questionsData.title: My friend is the same … as me.
He has …… cars than his friend
questionsData.explain_answer:
He has more cars than his friend.

"Cars" is a countable noun, as you can have multiple individual cars. When dealing with countable nouns, we use "many" for the plural form, but here we use"more" to compare quantities (than his friend).

questionsData.title: Some people in Yemen speak Arabic as….. English.
They played volleyball at the beach happily. The word "happily" is a/an ……
Where ….. you yesterday?
questionsData.explain_answer:
Where were you yesterday?

the verb "to be" (am, is, are, was, were) is used to indicate a state of existence or location. When asking about someone's location or existence at a specific time in the past, we use the past tense form of "to be .

questionsData.title: Scientists ……a cure for covid-19 next year.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Scientists are to find a cure for covid-19 next year.

"are to find" is the correct choice in this context because it suggests a future intention or plan. It implies that scientists have a goal or expectation to find a cure for COVID-19 in the coming year.

  • Have found: This suggests scientists definitively discovered a cure for covid-19 next year, which is unlikely given the ongoing research on COVID-19 treatments.
  • To find: This is the infinitive form of the verb and doesn't fit the sentence structure that talks about a future possibility.
  • Found: This could be grammatically correct, but it suggests the discovery has already happened, which wouldn't be accurate for next year.

questionsData.title: If I had my own home, I'd …. happily
Many schools were ……because of war.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Many schools were damaged  because of war.

  • Damage (noun) refers to the harm or destruction that something has suffered.
  • Damaged (adjective) describes something that has been harmed or destroyed.
  • Damages (plural noun) is a legal term referring to the financial compensation awarded for harm or loss.
  • Damaging (adjective) describes something that causes harm or destruction.

questionsData.title: The information …….given to the police two hours ago.
Have pupils……the class.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Use of have/get + infinitive

You use these verbs to replace other instruction words such as ask, tell or order.

Example:

Ask the boy to put away his bag.
→    Have the boy put away his bag.
→    Get the boy to put away his bag.
Note: With have, the infinitive is without to.
